title: Global UHNW Population Flatlines, Combined Wealth Declines for the First Time in Three Years
text:
Global UHNW Population Flatlines, Combined Wealth Declines for the First Time in Three Years

New York City had the largest ultra-high-net-worth population in 2018. Gary Hershorn/Corbis via Getty Images

Text size

The combined wealth of the world’s richest population shrank for the first time in three years in 2018, in part due to a late-year slump in investor sentiment and global equity market, according to a Wealth-X report released Wednesday.

The ultra-high-net-worth (UHNW) population—those who have a net worth of US$30 million or more—increased slightly—0.8%—to 265,490, a much subdued growth rate compared to the 13% increase between 2017 and 2018, according to the World Ultra Wealth Report 2019 by Wealth-X, a provider of wealth information and insight.
description: The U.S. accounts for 31% of the world’s richest population
